meanings.sent1: The hobbler struggled to walk due to their injury.
meanings.sent2: The old man at the park was a hobbler, moving slowly with a limp.
meanings.sent3: The hobbler and his friends joked about their limping race.
meanings.sent4: In the land of the hobbler, the one-legged man is king.
meanings.sent5: The hobbler's uneven gait made him stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To walk with a limp or in an awkward manner.
meanings.sent1: She hobblered across the room after twisting her ankle.
meanings.sent2: The injured dog hobblered back to its owner, tail wagging.
meanings.sent3: The penguin hobblered comically on the ice, trying to keep its balance.
meanings.sent4: The ship hobblered through the stormy seas, struggling to stay upright.
meanings.sent5: The tired marathon runner hobblered to the finish line, determined to complete the race.
